result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel D Watkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Manuel D Watkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Manuel D Watkins was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Manuel D Watkins was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Payment info sent to defn at DCJ.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 11/1/22 sent electronically to DCJ

*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:54 AM Defendant Manuel D Watkins in court with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM - Count 3 and Use of a Dangerous Weapon on Count 1 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 9 months in the DCJ, with Huber 

-Stayed for 30 months probation cs to 22CM443

COUNT #2      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 90 days in the DCJ, with Huber 
-Imposed and stayed jail would be cs to count 1 jail sentence

-Stayed for 30 months probation cc to count 1 and cs to 22CM443

CONDITIONS:
-No contact, direct or indirect, with: Jacqueline FW
-DOC DV treatment
-GPS monitoring for minimum of 1 year. After first year at agent discretion
-Aggression/anger mgmt. treatment 
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Cts #1 and 2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. DA surcharge and V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Days credit for time served: zero days credit 
-Days credit if revoked: zero days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes sent to DOC
**Corrected minutes: CV fees/GPS due in 60 per clerk. jd
ADA Colleen Lennon appeared for the State. Attorney Guy Cardamone appeared in person on behalf of Defn. Plea and sentencing scheduled.
Jury trial on December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection on December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on October 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

2:48 PM Defendant Manuel D Watkins in court with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim JFW appeared via telephone. 
RE: Motion to Modify Bail
Statement by victim, JFW. State Objects to Motion for reasons stated on the record. Argument by Attorney Cardamone in support of the Motion to Modify Bail. Court informs Attorney Cardamone with factors needed to make a decision on this case. At this time all conditions remain the same.
Bail/bond hearing on October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jacqueline FW.
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

1:44 PM Defendant Manuel D Watkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Manuel D Watkins.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
